v_nodesv.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /*****************************************************************************
00002 
00003   Description:  This file contains C routines to store and manipulate the
00004                 values assigned to an attribute or pointer.
00005  
00006   Author:  Randy Davis, University of Colorado LASP
00007  
00008   Creation Date:  12 March 1989
00009   Last Modified:  18 May 1991
00010 
00011   History:
00012 
00013     Creation - This set of routines was part of the Version 1 release of
00014     the ODLC library.
00015 
00016     Version 2.0 - 30 August 1990 - R. Davis, U. of Colorado LASP
00017       a) Changed to work with Version 2 parameter routines rather than
00018          the older Version attribute routines.
00019 
00020     Version 2.1 - 13 March 1991 - R. Davis, U. of Colorado LASP
00021       a) Added routines for cutting, copying and pasting values and
00022          recoded NewValue and RemoveValue to use these routines.
00023          The paste and cut routines increment and decrement the count
00024          of value nodes attached to a parameter.  Since NewValue and
00025          RemoveValue now use the paste and cut routines, they too
00026          update the value node counter.  Previously this updating had
00027          to be done outside of these routines.
00028 
00029   Version 2.2 - 18 May 1991 - M. DeMore, Jet Propulsion Laboratory
00030     a) Removed include statements that were Unix specific and placed them
00031        in odldef.h.
00032     b) Added code to NewValue to allocate space for string values rather
00033        than using the space passed in.
00034 
00035 *****************************************************************************/
00036 
00037 #include <stdlib.h>
00038 #include  "odldef.h"
00039 
00040 
00041 
00042 /*****************************************************************************
00043 
00044   Routine: NewValue
00045  
00046   Description: Adds a new value to a parameter.
00047  
00048   Input:
00049           parameter  - Pointer to the parameter node to which the value
00050                        is to be attached.
00051           value_data - Pointer to the data value and its format.
00052 
00053   Output: A pointer to the value node is returned as the function value.  A
00054           NULL value indicates that the value could not be added, probably
00055           due to lack of dynamic memory.  The NULL value is also returned
00056           if the value data argument is NULL.
00057  
00058 *****************************************************************************/
00059 
00060 
00061 VALUE NewValue (
00062 
00063      PARAMETER   parameter,
00064      VALUE_DATA *value_data)
00065 
00066 {
00067   VALUE  value;                /* Pointer to the new value node             */
00068 
00069 
00070   if (value_data == NULL)
00071     {
00072       return (NULL);
00073     }
00074 
00075   /* Allocate memory for the new value node */
00076 
00077   value = (VALUE) malloc (VALUE_NODE_SIZE);
00078   if (value == NULL)
00079     {
00080       /* Error: couldn't allocate memory to store value node */
00081 
00082       return (NULL);
00083     }
00084 
00085   /* Copy the value data into the new value node */
00086 
00087   value->item = *value_data;
00088 
00089   if (parameter != NULL)
00090     {
00091       /* Attach the new value node to its parameter */
00092 
00093       PasteValue (parameter, value);
00094     }
00095   else
00096     {
00097       /* There is no parameter to attach this value node to, so
00098          set the parent and sibling pointers to NULL */
00099 
00100       value->parameter     = NULL;
00101       value->left_sibling  = NULL;
00102       value->right_sibling = NULL;
00103     }
00104   return (value);
00105 }
00106

00108 
00109 
00110 /*****************************************************************************
00111 
00112   Routine: RemoveValue
00113  
00114   Description: Removes a value of a parameter.  The memory space used to
00115                hold the value node plus any additional memory used by
00116                the value itself is returned to the system.
00117  
00118   Input:
00119          value      - A pointer to the value node to be removed.
00120  
00121   Output: A pointer to the next value node is returned as the function 
00122           value.  The NULL value is returned if there is no next value
00123           for the parameter.  The NULL value is also returned if the
00124           input argument is NULL.
00125 
00126 *****************************************************************************/
00127  
00128 
00129 VALUE RemoveValue (
00130 
00131      VALUE     value)
00132 
00133 {
00134   VALUE      r_value;           /* Pointer to value's right sibling         */
00135   struct ODLUnits *units_field; /* Pointer to current units field descriptor*/
00136   struct ODLUnits *next_field;  /* Pointer to next units field descriptor   */
00137 
00138 
00139   /* Return immediately if there is nothing to remove */
00140 
00141   if (value == NULL)
00142     {
00143       return (NULL);
00144     }
00145 
00146   /* Free up any memory space used for storing the value.  This is the case
00147      for string and symbol values and for the units of a real or integer
00148      number */
00149 
00150   switch (value->item.type)
00151    {
00152     case TV_STRING:  case TV_SYMBOL:
00153 
00154       /* Free up the space used to hold the text of the string or symbol */
00155 
00156       if(value->item.value.string != NULL)
00157       {
00158         free (value->item.value.string);
00159     value->item.value.string = NULL;
00160       }
00161       break;
00162 
00163     case TV_INTEGER: case TV_REAL:
00164 
00165       /* Free up the space used to hold any units fields */
00166 
00167       if (value->item.type == TV_INTEGER)
00168         {
00169           units_field = value->item.value.integer.units;
00170         }
00171       else
00172         {
00173           units_field = value->item.value.real.units;
00174         }
00175 
00176       while (units_field != NULL)
00177         {
00178           next_field = units_field->next_field;
00179           free (units_field->designator);
00180           free (units_field);
00181           units_field = next_field;
00182         }
00183 
00184       break;
00185 
00186     default:
00187 
00188       break;
00189    }
00190 
00191   /* Save a pointer to the next value node in the list of values, if any */
00192 
00193   r_value = value->right_sibling;
00194 
00195   /* Detach the value from its parameter node */
00196 
00197   CutValue (value);
00198 
00199   /* Free up the memory space used to hold the value node */
00200 
00201   free (value);
00202   value = NULL;
00203 
00204   /* Return a pointer to the next value attached to the parameter, if any */
00205 
00206   return (r_value);
00207 }
00208

00212 /*****************************************************************************
00213 
00214   Routine: FirstValue
00215  
00216   Description: Returns the first value associated with a parameter.
00217  
00218   Input:
00219           parameter - A pointer to the parameter.
00220  
00221   Output: A pointer to the first value node is returned as the function.
00222           The value NULL is returned if there are no values for this
00223           parameter.  The NULL value is also returned if the input
00224           argument is NULL.
00225 
00226 *****************************************************************************/
00227  
00228 
00229 VALUE FirstValue (
00230 
00231      PARAMETER   parameter)
00232 
00233 {
00234 
00235   if (parameter == NULL)
00236     {
00237       return (NULL);
00238     }
00239   else
00240     {
00241       return (parameter->first_value);
00242     }
00243 
00244 }
00245

00248 
00249 /*****************************************************************************
00250 
00251   Routine: NextValue
00252  
00253   Description: Returns the next value of an attribute or pointer.
00254  
00255   Input:
00256           value      - A pointer to the current value node.
00257  
00258   Output: A pointer to the next value node is returned as the function
00259           value.  The value NULL is returned if there are no more 
00260           values for the parameter.  The NULL value is also returned
00261           if the input argument is NULL.
00262 
00263 *****************************************************************************/
00264  
00265 
00266 VALUE NextValue (
00267 
00268      VALUE     value)
00269 
00270 {
00271 
00272   if (value == NULL)
00273     {
00274       return (NULL);
00275     }
00276   else
00277     {
00278       return (value->right_sibling);
00279     }
00280 
00281 }

00285 
00286 /*****************************************************************************
00287 
00288   Routine: CopyValue
00289  
00290   Description: Copies a value node.
00291  
00292   Input:
00293           value   - A pointer to the value node to be copied.  The
00294                     input value node remains in the ODL tree after
00295                     the copy is made.
00296  
00297   Output: A pointer to the copied value node is returned as the function
00298           result. The NULL value is returned if the input argument is
00299           NULL or if storage couldn't be obtained for the copy.
00300 
00301 *****************************************************************************/
00302  
00303 
00304 VALUE CopyValue (
00305 
00306      VALUE     value)
00307 
00308 {
00309   VALUE            value_copy;       /* Copy of the specified value         */
00310   VALUE_DATA       item_copy;        /* Copy of the value data structure    */
00311   struct ODLUnits *units;            /* Pointer to units field being copied */
00312   struct ODLUnits *units_copy;       /* Copy of the units structure         */
00313   struct ODLUnits *next_field;       /* Pointer to next units field, if any */
00314   struct ODLUnits *first_units_copy; /* Pointer to first units field copy   */
00315   struct ODLUnits *last_units_copy;  /* Pointer to last units field copy    */
00316   char            *string;           /* Copy of name string                 */
00317 
00318 
00319   if (value == NULL)
00320     {
00321       return (NULL);
00322     }
00323 
00324   /* Fill in the value type-independent fields of the value data structure */
00325 
00326   item_copy.type      = value->item.type;
00327   item_copy.valid     = value->item.valid;
00328   item_copy.format    = value->item.format;
00329   item_copy.precision = value->item.precision;
00330   item_copy.length    = value->item.length;
00331 
00332   /* Fill in the value type-dependent part of the value data structure */
00333 
00334   switch (item_copy.type)
00335     {
00336       case TV_STRING:  case TV_SYMBOL:
00337 
00338         /* Copy character string and attach it to the value node */
00339 
00340         string = (char *) malloc (item_copy.length+1);
00341         if (string == NULL)
00342           {
00343             /* Error: couldn't get memory for the copy of the string */
00344 
00345             return (NULL);
00346           }
00347 
00348         item_copy.value.string = strcpy (string, value->item.value.string);
00349 
00350         break;
00351 
00352       case TV_INTEGER:  case TV_REAL:
00353 
00354         /* Copy the number value and get a pointer to first units, if any */
00355 
00356         if (item_copy.type == TV_INTEGER)
00357           {
00358             item_copy.value.integer.number = value->item.value.integer.number;
00359             units = value->item.value.integer.units;
00360           }
00361         else
00362           {
00363             item_copy.value.real.number = value->item.value.real.number;
00364             units = value->item.value.real.units;
00365           }
00366 
00367         first_units_copy = NULL;
00368 
00369         while (units != NULL)
00370           {
00371             /* Allocate space for the copy of the units field */
00372 
00373             units_copy = (struct ODLUnits *) malloc (sizeof(struct ODLUnits));
00374             string = (char *) malloc (strlen (units->designator)+1);
00375 
00376             if (units_copy == NULL || string == NULL)
00377               {
00378                 /* Error: couldn't get enough storage space to copy
00379                    the units.  Rather than leave the copy operation
00380                    in an unknown state, we release all storage space
00381                    and return */
00382 
00383                 units_copy = first_units_copy;
00384 
00385                 while (units_copy != NULL)
00386                   {
00387                     next_field = units_copy->next_field;
00388                     free (units_copy->designator);
00389                     free (units_copy);
00390 
00391                     units_copy = next_field;
00392                   }
00393 
00394                 return (NULL);
00395               }
00396 
00397             /* Copy the units information */
00398 
00399             units_copy->designator = strcpy (string, units->designator);
00400             units_copy->exponent   = units->exponent;
00401             units_copy->next_field = NULL;
00402 
00403             /* Attach the units information */
00404 
00405             if (first_units_copy == NULL)
00406               {
00407                 first_units_copy = units_copy;
00408               }
00409             else
00410               {
00411                 last_units_copy->next_field = units_copy;
00412               }
00413 
00414             last_units_copy = units_copy;
00415             units = units->next_field;
00416           }
00417 
00418         /* Attach the units field(s) to the value node */
00419 
00420         if (item_copy.type == TV_INTEGER)
00421           {
00422             item_copy.value.integer.units = first_units_copy;
00423           }
00424         else
00425           {
00426             item_copy.value.real.units = first_units_copy;
00427           }
00428 
00429         break;
00430 
00431       case TV_DATE:  case TV_TIME:   case TV_DATE_TIME:
00432 
00433         /* Copy the date and time fields */
00434 
00435         item_copy.value.date_time = value->item.value.date_time;
00436 
00437         break;
00438 
00439       default:
00440 
00441         break;
00442      }
00443 
00444   /* Create a new stand-alone value node containing the copied data */
00445 
00446   value_copy = NewValue (NULL, &item_copy);
00447  
00448   return (value_copy);
00449 }

00453 
00454 /*****************************************************************************
00455 
00456   Routine: CutValue
00457  
00458   Description: Detaches a value node from its parameter node.
00459  
00460   Input:
00461          value      - A pointer to the value node to be cut.
00462  
00463   Output: A pointer to the cut value node is returned as the function 
00464           result.  The NULL value is returned if the input argument
00465           is NULL.
00466 
00467 *****************************************************************************/
00468  
00469 
00470 VALUE CutValue (
00471 
00472      VALUE     value)
00473 
00474 {
00475   PARAMETER  parameter;         /* Pointer to parameter node                */
00476   VALUE      l_value;           /* Pointer to value's left sibling          */
00477   VALUE      r_value;           /* Pointer to value's right sibling         */
00478 
00479  /* Remove the value from the list of values for its parameter node */
00480 
00481   if (value == NULL)
00482      return (NULL);
00483 
00484   parameter = value->parameter;
00485   l_value   = value->left_sibling;
00486   r_value   = value->right_sibling;
00487 
00488   if (l_value != NULL)
00489    {
00490      l_value->right_sibling = r_value;
00491    }
00492   else if (parameter != NULL)
00493    {
00494      parameter->first_value = r_value;
00495    }
00496 
00497   if (r_value != NULL)
00498    {
00499      r_value->left_sibling = l_value;
00500    }
00501   else if (parameter != NULL)
00502    {
00503      parameter->last_value = l_value;
00504    }
00505 
00506   /* Decrement the count of value nodes attached to the parameter */
00507 
00508   if (parameter != NULL)
00509     {
00510       parameter->value_count--;
00511     }
00512 
00513   /* Reset the parent and sibling pointers to indicate this node now
00514      stands by itself */
00515 
00516   value->parameter     = NULL;
00517   value->left_sibling  = NULL;
00518   value->right_sibling = NULL;
00519   
00520   /* Return a pointer to the detached node */
00521 
00522   return (value);
00523 }
00524 
00525 
00526 
00527 
00528 /*****************************************************************************
00529 
00530   Routine: PasteValue
00531  
00532   Description: Attaches a value node to a parameter node.
00533  
00534   Input:
00535           parameter  - Pointer to the parameter node to which the value
00536                        node is to be attached.
00537           value      - Pointer to the value node to be attached.
00538 
00539   Output: A pointer to the pasted value node is returned as the function
00540           result.  A NULL value will be returned if either of the input
00541           arguments is NULL.
00542  
00543 *****************************************************************************/
00544 
00545 
00546 VALUE PasteValue (
00547 
00548      PARAMETER  parameter,
00549      VALUE      value)
00550 
00551 {
00552   VALUE  old_last;             /* Pointer to previous last value            */
00553 
00554 
00555   if (parameter == NULL || value == NULL)
00556     {
00557       return (NULL);
00558     }
00559 
00560   /* Place the value node at the end of the list of values for the
00561      parameter */
00562 
00563   old_last = parameter->last_value;
00564   if (old_last != NULL)
00565     {
00566       old_last->right_sibling = value;
00567     }
00568 
00569   parameter->last_value = value;
00570   if (parameter->first_value == NULL)
00571     {
00572       parameter->first_value = value;
00573     }
00574 
00575   value->parameter     = parameter;
00576   value->left_sibling  = old_last;
00577   value->right_sibling = NULL;
00578 
00579   /* Increment the count of value nodes attached to the parameter */
00580 
00581   parameter->value_count++;
00582 
00583   /* Return a pointer to the pasted value node */
00584 
00585   return (value);
00586 }
